decks.notes: The main strategy of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with cheap, aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Healer's Hawk, while buffing them with cards like Benalish Marshal and Venerated Loxodon. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent by constantly pressuring them with creatures and establishing a strong board presence. Cards like Conclave Tribunal and History of Benalia help to control the opponent's threats and maintain board control, allowing the deck to continue its aggressive strategy until victory.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive Selesnya Aggro strategy. It relies on generating a wide board presence through cards like Saproling Migration, Legion's Landing, and March of the Multitudes, backed up by powerful creatures like Venerated Loxodon and Adanto Vanguard. Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants provides additional support and resilience, while Trostani Discordant and Emmara, Soul of the Accord help to maintain board presence and generate additional tokens. Conclave Tribunal provides removal and disruption, while History of Benalia and Flower / Flourish offer additional synergy and finishing power.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures with strong enter-the-battlefield effects, supported by removal spells to control the board. The deck includes powerful cards like Wildgrowth Walker and Jadelight Ranger to gain life and draw cards, while also featuring Vraska, Relic Seeker and Vivien Reid for additional value. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient creatures and removal, setting up for big plays with cards like Find / Finality and Doom Whisperer. It prioritizes a strong board presence and constant pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to have strong early game creatures like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Jadelight Ranger and Seekers' Squire to help smooth out draws and ensure consistent land drops. Utilizing cards like Find / Finality and Vraska's Contempt, the deck can generate value from graveyard recursion and removal spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures with explore abilities to generate card advantage and put pressure on the opponent. It also includes removal spells to control the opponent's board and powerful late-game threats like Carnage Tyrant and Doom Whisperer. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by recycling creatures from the graveyard with Golgari Findbroker and using Planeswalkers like Vraska and Vivien to provide additional card advantage and threats. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Enigma Drake, Crackling Drake, and Arclight Phoenix to deal damage quickly and aggressively. By including cards like Warlord's Fury, Maximize Velocity, Crash Through, and Chart a Course, the deck aims to draw cards and increase the power of its creatures. Removal spells like Lava Coil, Deafening Clarion, and Shock help control the board while Opt provides card selection. The mana base consists of lands that can produce both red and blue mana, along with Sacred Foundry for white mana if needed.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful control spells and card advantage to outvalue the opponent. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria is the centerpiece of the deck, providing card advantage and removal while also generating card advantage with his +1 ability. Other key cards like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake provide win conditions while also drawing cards. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by countering threats, removing creatures, and drawing cards until it can establish a dominating board presence and close out the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play creatures with ramp options like Llanowar Elves and Druid of the Cowl to build up your board presence. Use cards like Merfolk Branchwalker and Jadelight Ranger to help dig for the cards you need. Utilize removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Ravenous Chupacabra to control the board, while also using Find / Finality to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. Finish off your opponent with powerful threats like Carnage Tyrant and Vraska, Golgari Queen.

The deck focuses on using cheap spells and card draw to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes. By utilizing cards like Tormenting Voice, Chart a Course, and Radical Idea, the deck aims to bring back multiple Phoenixes from the graveyard in a single turn, overwhelming the opponent with hasty fliers. Cards like Crackling Drake and Dive Down provide additional threats and protection, while Goblin Electromancer helps reduce the cost of spells. The deck prioritizes aggressive plays and efficient card draw to maintain pressure and build a powerful board presence.

The main idea of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and value creatures, all while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage and board presence. By utilizing explore creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker to ramp up, along with removal spells like Ravenous Chupacabra and Vraska's Contempt to control the board, this deck aims to apply early pressure and out-value the opponent in the mid to late game. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful finishers like Carnage Tyrant and Doom Whisperer ensures a strong win condition against slower decks.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while controlling the board through counter spells and removal. The deck utilizes cards like Sinister Sabotage, Syncopate, and Essence Scatter to counter threats, while Cleansing Nova and Deafening Clarion wipe the board clean. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and control over the opponent's spells, while Crackling Drake provides a win condition with its ability to grow in power. Overall, this deck aims to dominate the game through control and attrition.

The deck focuses on early creature aggression and card advantage, utilizing the explore mechanic to quickly build a threatening board presence. It includes a mix of strong creatures like Carnage Tyrant and Ravenous Chupacabra, as well as cards like Midnight Reaper and Vivien Reid to maintain a steady stream of resources. With a balance of removal spells and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats while grinding out value in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by countering the opponent's spells, drawing cards, and clearing the board with powerful spells like Deafening Clarion and Cleansing Nova. It also aims to win through card advantage and powerful finishers like Niv-Mizzet, Parun and Crackling Drake. The control aspect of the deck is supported by a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw spells, while the win condition comes from efficiently managing resources and outvaluing the opponent.

The UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with spells to bring back powerful creatures like Arclight Phoenix and utilize them to deal damage to the opponent. With cards like Crackling Drake and Goblin Electromancer to support the strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. The key concept is to efficiently cast spells, trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, and use the graveyard as a resource to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat abilities. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Rekindling Phoenix, while also utilizing cards like Resplendent Angel and Lyra Dawnbringer to gain a huge advantage in combat. Tocatli Honor Guard helps against creature-based decks, while removal spells like Lava Coil and Ixalan's Binding provide necessary interaction. History of Benalia further boosts the aggression of the deck, aiming to close out games quickly with a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays using cheap spells and creatures to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The key strategy is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and utilize Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells. By using card draw spells like Chart a Course and Tormenting Voice, along with powerful creatures like Crackling Drake and Niv-Mizzet, Parun, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.
